com.pump.image

Class SCImageContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pump.image.ImageContext
      • com.pump.image.SCImageContext

  • public class SCImageContext
extends ImageContext
    Spatial-Coherence optimized implementation of ImageContext.

    This implementation takes advantage of spatial coherence between pixels to improve the rendering performance.

    Instead of performing a perspective transform for each individual pixel, this implementation only transforms the four corners of the image, and then uses hyperbolic interpolation for the remaining pixels.

    In order to take advantage of spacial coherence, the number of tiles should be kept low, because only a small amount of spatial coherence is shared between tiles. Therefore this implementation is best suited for systems with a small number of processors.

    This class only implements nearest neighbor interpolation. A higher quality interpolation scheme can easily implemented by super sampling pixels from the source image.

    See Also:
    ImageContextDemo

      • SCImageContext

        public SCImageContext(java.awt.image.BufferedImage bi,
                      int numberOfThreads)
        Create a Graphics3D context that paints to a destination image.
        Parameters:
        bi - an RGB or ARGB image.
        numberOfThreads - if positive then this is the number of threads used to render tiles. If zero then calls to drawImage are not multithreaded.

    • Method Detail

      • getPixels

        protected int[] getPixels(java.awt.image.BufferedImage bi)
        Return all the pixels in the argument in ARGB format.

      • drawImage

        public void drawImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img,
                      java.awt.geom.Point2D topLeft,
                      java.awt.geom.Point2D topRight,
                      java.awt.geom.Point2D bottomRight,
                      java.awt.geom.Point2D bottomLeft)
        Draw an image to this Graphics3D.

        This respects the interpolation rendering hints. When the interpolation hint is missing, this will also consult the antialiasing hint or the render hint. The bilinear hint is used by default.

        This uses a source over composite.

        Specified by:
        drawImage in class ImageContext
        Parameters:
        img - the image to draw.
        topLeft - where the top-left corner of this image will be painted.
        topRight - where the top-right corner of this image will be painted.
        bottomRight - where the bottom-right corner of this image will be painted.
        bottomLeft - where the bottom-left corner of this image will be painted.
